Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content:
We'll go command line on it...
Open a command prompt,
go to the folder where your Agama.exe is unpacked and go to 
`resources\app\assets\bin\win64\`
Type `komodo-cli stop`

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: That should stop komodo. If that doesn't work, kill it using task manager

don't delete anything unless you being told to delete something, my advice, wait for the next hyperdex release which supports refunding stuck swaps, until then, there is not much more you can do than you were already advised.

Author: merrij#8253
Content: hello 😉 is there a new guide for staking KMD? Because after the hack and my transfer to a new address in June, the staking isn´t working any longer in the Agama wallet. thx

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
KMD is not staking. 
You can claim rewards up to  every 30 days. In Agama, send your whole balance to yourself to the same address, and reward will be claimed/added to your balance.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: If you are using lite mode (seed) you can use that seed in the mobile atomicDEX wallet, where you can find a `claim` button to help you with the claiming process.

Author: merrij#8253
Content: @Oszy Thank you. Well, there was the claiming button in Agama for a while. I will check it out with the sending.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: The green check UTXO button should be still there

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: @merrij

Author: merrij#8253
Content: @Oszy Yeah, I received my 1.49 free coins 😋

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: Don't forget to do it every 30 days, it stops accumulating after that

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content:
@Oszy On my linux box's crontab for the komodo-CLI:
```
* 0 1 * * <SOME-PATH>/komodo-cli sendtoaddress "MY-ADDRESS" $(<SOME-PATH>/komodo-cli getbalance) true 2>&1 |/usr/bin/ts 1>><ANOTHER PATH>/komodo-reward.log 2>&1
```

Author: 𝙊𝙞𝙣𝙠#3612
Content: I never forget...

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Can anyone from the Komodo team confirm or deny if the concept of the DEX coin holders receiving 50% of the AtomicDEX fees is still valid for AtomicDEX? I couldn't find any official statement regarding this, but it has been described here:

Author: Arno#3334
Content: https://webworker.sh/assetchains

Author: Arno#3334
Content: There must be an official statement of what will be done with the fees generated by AtomicDEX.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
Not a team member but yes it  is still valid for AtomicDEX, you can see collected fees by Dex here: https://dexstats.info/assetviewer.php?address=RThtXup6Zo7LZAi8kRWgjAyi1s4u6U9Cpf

It's not just atomicdex mobile fees, it's fees from every trade that uses / will use the atomicdex/marketmaker2 platform.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Do you have an official source apart from the address accumulating the fee funds? Because it's one thing that there's an address collecting all fees, but another thing of what will happen with those funds. For example, have they ever been distributed so far? And to whom? Are there records of it?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: All we know for now is that there's a fee address accumulating funds, nothing more.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content:
#ask-jl777 he can officially answer your question.
No nothing has been distributed yet. As far as I know it will happen at $1M USD collected.

Author: Arno#3334
Content: It's strange that this is not defined somewhere, like in a whitepaper or website. Compare it to other "dividend tokens", such as SpectreAI SXDT, Tenx Rewards token, etc. All well-defined.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what oszy says is correct

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we never did any ICO or offering for DEX, it was issued in 2014 on NXT platform

Author: Arno#3334
Content: And DEX is the official dividend token?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we dont do any promotion of it

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Why is this not properly communicated?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: DEX is the official revshare coin

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Like being transparent regarding the structure, fees, and receiver of fees etc.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is one thing if someone seeks the information out

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but we dont want to be doing anything that could be considered promoting it

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Thanks for taking the time to answer, by the way.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: half the fees go to DEX, distributed when there is sufficient amount collected

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is transparent and the people that know, know

Author: Arno#3334
Content: So how are all the other funds supposed to be converted (and distributed) to KMD on the fly before distributing them?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for coins with significant amounts, atomicDEX will be used to convert it to KMD

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Are they being sold on AtomicDEX themselves then?

Author: Arno#3334
Content: I see.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: DEX is only trading in the after market, by people that already have it

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Yes. Do you know any other trading places besides AtomicDEX? It's hard to get in quantities.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: other than atomicDEX, OTC would be the only way i know of

Author: Arno#3334
Content: So far I thought KMD would be the beneficiary of AtomicDEX, but now it sounds more like it's DEX.

Author: Oszy#5734
Content: You get discount on fees for KMD pairs, 10% right jl?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, and all the non-KMD fees will drive demand for KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it is important to keep KMD a currency and move anything that can be interpreted as a security away from KMD

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is only 1 million DEX, so compared to KMD of 116 million, the revshare is much more meaningful for DEX

Author: Arno#3334
Content: Thanks for clarifying.

Author: Cryptoon#3362
Content: Dont forget, that the DEX revshare needs to be converted into kmd. So all the third party coins need to be sold into kmd so they can be distributed as dividends to DEX holders. This alone will increase demand even more for kmd. Apart from people mainly wanting to trade kmd pairs because of lower fees 😉
